articles.title: 'Call the police': Woman without mask on bus taunts SBS Transit staff - AsiaOne
articles.description: More than a year into the pandemic, some people in Singapore still refuse to abide by Covid-19 rules. On Monday (June 14) night, a woman made a scene aboard bus service 69 in Bedok as she refused to wear a face mask. A passenger told Shin Min Daily News that …
articles.content:

articles.title: M'sia beat Thailand 1-0 to end qualifying campaign in third - The Star Online
articles.description: PETALING JAYA: Harimau Malaya ended their Group G second-round World Cup 2022-Asian Cup 2023 qualifying campaign in third after beating Thailand 1-0 at the Al-Maktoum Stadium in Dubai on Wednesday.

articles.title: New agricultural visa to include South-East Asian workers but farmers remain unconvinced - ABC News
articles.description: A new farm work visa will be offered to residents from 10 South-East Asian nations to help Australian farmers harvest their crops, but the the peak farm lobby says it will have to see it to believe it.

articles.title: India achieve the bare minimum, qualify for Round 3 of Asian Cup qualifiers - The Indian Express
articles.description: Both goals were scored by Afghanistan players as goalkeeper Ovays Azizi dropped a routine catch into his own goal in the 75th minute to give the Indians the lead.
articles.content: India needed a draw against Afghanistan to secure the third spot in Group E of the World Cup Qualifiers and make it to the third round of the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers, a target they achieved after a … [+4309 chars]
